column18: This is so sick man! Big well done to both of you! One of the things I find amazing about this group (and musicianship in general) is that we all naturally pull towards creativity as a means of entertaining ourselves, as apposed to wasting time on meaningless endeavours and projects! I think this is something that you both highlight here.. just the pure fulfilment of making music. It's amazing, and I highly respect your proactivity and creativity. Well done!!

column38: I love this. I can hear the words as you play the song. That's so important. Also, you and I have a different idea of what the melody is. It's hard to tell on these Dan songs because the harmonies are so tight and every note seems as important as the other one. Also, you decided to play the major third on "when you get HOME" and I always sing the minor. So interesting and awesome to hear!

column70: It's kind of like the book "Superchops" by Howard Roberts: straight 1/8's pick every note (repeated notes are ok), but find the tempo you're comfortable doing it for 5 or 10 min straight at, then slowly go up in tempo. I can maybe hang at 120 for a couple minutes! :-)
